title: Lolclient.exe eating up bandwith after 6.19
body:
Just having the lolclient.exe is taking up all my internet. (Yes really crappy internet)

I can only play after the game launches and force closing it in task manager.

What causes this? I've disabled P2P sharing in the launcher too.

replies.body:
Exact same problem. League is eating up anywhere between 1-2 Mbps (viewed in task manager) to the extend that I can't even view( status's put up by friends in the client.

This has started occuring since the new tab has appeared on the left hand side. Making a support ticket about this as well.

Strange that it's causing the client itself to lag. Following are it's repurcussions

1.)  Unknown error occured appears very often. 

2.) I can't click accept when I start a game the client lags out.

3.) Very frequently get the "Retrieving data from server" message

4.) Currently trying to start an Aram, have clicked accept. I'm stuck at the "waiting for other players" for past 15s. 

Not sure why this is happening. Are there any files you would like me to provide?

Nothing has really changed that would require more bandwidth, but keep in mind that matches requires a strong, consistent connection to play.  I suggest using our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot and find what might be causing this to happen.  Let me know if you have any questions!
